Body:
English word "and" is cognate to another English word "end", both originating from PIE root a̯ent- meaning "end". The meaning shifted to "in front of" as in a̯enti and later to "near", "next".

The meaning of "and" was conducted in PIE with a clitic -q̆e which was attached to the last word, like Latin -que ("senatus populusque", "senate and the people").

There was no conjunction "and" in PIE, although, one could use the word e̯eti meaning "in addition", "also", "besides".

This word exactly evolved into Latin conjusnction "et".
